job_title: Talent Acquisition Specialist in Americus, GA
pros: Magnolia Manor has been great for me. I started off as an initial intern, and was given the chance to prove myself, and land a position within the company. The staff has always been very helpful, and will answer any question I have. Administrators communicate effectively, and have always ensured job functions are carried out. All around this is a great place to pursue a career with!
cons: I do not have any real cons of working here. I recommend this place to anyone interested in the positions offered!

job_title: Charge Nurse in Groves, TX
pros: It was clean and well kept. The lockdown for the overnight shift was comforting considering the location was sketchy.
cons: They were always short-handed for nursing staff. Pt:nurse 1:24.The LVN was basically a MA and the DON wasn't any help after working 2 weeks of doubles with little to no help. As the RN, guess who is responsible for an incident the overworked LVN makes? If you value your license, this isn't the place for you.

pros: Fellow nurses are usually new.
cons: Poor patient care, runs short staff and administration covers up.

review_title: Coworkers were good, management was not.
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Columbus, GA
pros: Preceptor very helpful and good to new CNAs, older CNAs very nice and willing to mentor.
cons: Management was a mess. No good system for filing complaints/voicing concerns. They were not interested.

job_title: Hospitality Aide & CNA in Inman, SC
pros:
You get to really care for amazing residents that you'll never forget. They paid for my CNA class.
Half of the nurses are amazing. 
The management is great.
cons:
Still haven't received any of my paychecks. I had direct deposit. 
Minimum wage. 
Didn't even realize we had a doctor assigned to our wing until a fire alarm went off and he came scurrying out of his office. 
Some nurses are great. Some are horrible and abusive or neglectful. 
They have older CNAs that haven't been trained in a very long time so they don't follow important rules. 
I watched CNAs ignore residents for hours and tell them "you're gonna have to wait" way too many times. 
The residents are treated horribly by most nurses. There are a few good ones but they're very few. 
There are a few CNAs that are not cut out for taking care of other people and we all report these problems yet they're still there being abusive to residents. I left because the residents told me I was too good for this place and that as much as I wanted to change it that I couldn't. It's bad when residents love you enough to tell you to get out. It really hurt me emotionally and mentally to see how they're treated.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Greenville, SC
pros: I Like the work environment
cons: They Need to pay more

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Columbus, GA
pros: people I worked with on day to day supported each other
cons: administrative and supervisory staff will smile at your face and stab you in back the next second.  They are out for themselves and don't care who they throw under the bus.  They will lie, make up lies, or avoid talking to you.  They control with power.  they will change policy at a moment notice and pretend that it been changed for months or a year.  employees have lost benefits due to this change in policy.   they find ways to get employees out the door when they try to voice their concerns or problems.
